body_content.explanation: an attack intended to stop or oppose an attack by an enemy:
examples: The military expects insurgents to mount a counterattack on supply lines.
He ordered a swift counterattack against the invaders.

body_content.explanation: in politics, etc., criticism or arguments intended to stop or oppose someone who has opposed or criticized you :
examples: The Republicans have still not been able to launch a strong counterattack against the new healthcare system.
There were questions about his integrity, but he always had an explanation - and a counterattack.

body_content.explanation: in sports, a move forward in an attempt to score points, goals, etc., at a time when your opponent is moving in the opposite direction or trying to score:
examples: Birmingham City were caught out by a counterattack in the last minute of the game.

body_content.explanation: an action in business intended to stop or oppose an action against you by a competitor:
examples: The tech giant launched a counterattack against its rival.

body_content.explanation: to attack an enemy in order to stop or oppose their attack on you:
examples: The air force counterattacked and repelled the invasion.

body_content.explanation: to criticize or argue against an opponent who has criticized or opposed you:
examples: Mr Deforge counterattacked by bringing charges for defamation.

body_content.explanation: in sports, to move forward in an attempt to score points, goals, etc., at a time when your opponent is moving forward or trying to score:
examples: We have the ability to catch teams out by counterattacking with speed.

body_content.explanation: to take action against a competitor in business who has taken action against you:
examples: Engineers from a rival company counterattacked with a new product.
